paper_abstract: An nonparametric additive model for the location and dispersion of a continuous response with an arbitrary smooth conditional distribution is proposed. B-splines are used to specify the three components of the model. It can deal with interval censored data and multiple covariates. After a simulation study, the relation between age, the number of years of full-time education and the net income (provided as intervals) available per person in Belgian households is studied from survey data.
paper_title: Nonparametric additive location-scale models for interval censored data
